lead_paragraph: SOALT--Arthur, beloved husband, father, grandfather, and brother, died peacefully from kidney failure in his family's embrace on Thursday, March 17, 2016, at the age of 90, in his Amherst, Massachusetts home. Arthur, a proud Brooklyn-Boy of the 1920's, played stick-ball, loved egg creams, and served valiantly in World War II, earning a bronze star. He later attended NYU and married Adele Pintchik at the age of 24. While enjoying 65 years of marriage he and his wife fought for civil and human rights, and helped establish one of Long Island's first integrated school systems, receiving statewide recognition. Arty, a lover of auctions, travel, and Vermont, where he and his wife refurbished an old home, overcame prostate cancer, leukemia, heart issues, and many other health complications. A courageous and loving man renowned for his authenticity, sharp wit, and devotion, he is survived by his wife Adele, brother Jerome, daughters Eva, Melissa, and Nina, and his beloved grandchildren Isaiah and Gabriel. His funeral will be held on Sunday March 20, 1:30pm at Abraham Green and Son Funeral home, 88 Beach Road, Fairfield, CT, 06825. 1/3
